data: Scope

This Privacy Policy applies to any IFB device, application or online application that refers to or links to the Policy (collectively, our Services). This Privacy Policy applies regardless of whether you use a computer, mobile phone, tablet, voice-enabled device or TV to access our Services.
The types of personal data we collect:
Contact information-such as name, address, phone number, email address and login information.

label: collection

data: Data identifying the appliance-such as serial number, software version, MAC address, model, colour etc.
label: collection

label: collection

data: Device permissions for personal Data access:
Depending on the User's specific device, this Application may request certain permissions which will allow the access to the Users device data.

By default, these permissions must be granted by the User before the respective information can be accessed. Once the permission has been given, it can be revoked by the User at any time. In order to revoke these permissions, Users may refer to the device settings or contact the Data Controller for support using the contact details provided in this document.
The exact procedure for controlling app permissions may be dependent on the User's device and software.
Please note that the revoking of such permissions might impact the proper functioning of this Application.
If the user grants any of the permissions listed below, the respective Personal Data may be processed (ie accessed to, modified or removed) by this Application.
Approximate location permission (non-continuous)
Used for accessing the User's approximate device location. This Application may collect, use and share the User's location data in order to provide location-based services.

data: Mode and place of processing the Data
Methods of processing

The Data Controller processes user's data in a proper manner and shall take appropriate security measures to prevent unauthorised access, disclosure, modification or unauthorised destruction of the data.

The data processing is carried out using computers and/or IT enabled tools, following organisational procedures and modes strictly related to the purposes indicated. In addition to the Data Controller, in some cases, the data may be accessible to certain types of persons involved with the operation of the site (administration, sales, marketing, legal, system administration) or external parties (such as third-party technical service providers, mail carriers, hosting providers, IT companies, communications agencies) if necessary, as Data Processors by the Data Controller. An updated list of these parties may be requested from the Data Controller at any time.
label: sharing

data: Place

The data is processed at the Data Controllers operating offices and in any other places where the parties involved with the processing are located. For further information, please contact the Data Controller.
Retention time

The data is kept for the time required to provide the service requested by the User or stated by the purposes outlined in this document.The User may request that the Data Controller to suspend or remove the data at any time.
HOW DO WE USE YOUR INFORMATION?
We may use information we collect for the following purposes:
To register you or your device for a Service.

We may combine information from or about you, including across different Services or devices, for purposes consistent with this Privacy Policy. For example, we may use your IFB account details across all of the Services that require an IFB account. Or we might base recommendations, customised content and personalised features to provide you with an enhanced experience of the Services. Depending on the reason for which we combine the data, and persuant to the requirements of applicable law, specific controls for such combinations may be made available, for instance in the settings menusof the device or application or by visiting the applicable web pages.

data: How do we secure your data? To protect your data, we will take appropriate measures that are consistent with applicable data protection and data security laws and regulations, including requiring our service providers to use appropriate measures to protect the confidentiality and security of your data. Depending on the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature of the data to be protected, we put in place technical and organisational measures to prevent risks such as destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of or access to your data.
